definition: content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: Grandpa is under the weather today.
His wife says he's indisposed , but I know he's drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他妻子說他身體欠安，但我知道他是喝醉了。

sentences.english: Please pray for those brothers and sisters who are not in good health.
sentences.chinese: 請爲身體欠安的弟兄姐妹代禱。

sentences.english: There is good in her, in spite of her bad reputation.
sentences.chinese: 雖然她名聲欠安，她照舊有善的一壁。

definition: to be ill/to be in bad health
the Emperor's body/Holy body/the current reigning Emperor
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
(literary) I, your servant (self-appellation of a lower-rank female)/(archaic) male and female slaves/subjects (of a ruler)
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
